alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset and central Middlesex Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Brunswick, or near New Brunswick, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, Jamesburg, Dayton, Kendall Park, Society Hill, North Brunswick Township, Kingston, Whittingham, South River, Highland Park, Milltown, South Bound Brook, Helmetta, Monmouth Junction and Heathcote. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 9 and 10. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern New Jersey.
